website_summaries.verdict: If you're on a strict budget and can't spend more than $40, the Sennheiser HD 202 IIs are a worthwhile entry point for aftermarket cans, boasting a comfortable fit and the company's excellent signature sound.
pros: Closed-back design filters ambient noise, comfortable fit with extra padding on the headband, excellent sound quality for budget price tag
cons: The 10-foot long cable is annoying to use outside the home, it lacks mobile controls and a microphone for smartphones, has a plastic frame

customer_reviews.title: these were the best disposable headphones on the market
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in 2011 for $20. For that price, these were the best disposable headphones on the market. Now in 2018, I see they tripled the price to $60. These headphones have a cheap feel to them are not worth any more than $30 to me. They're taking advantage of having the great reviews from 2011 to try and sell these at double or triple their value. Don't fall for it!!
customer_reviews.author: Hooked On Technology

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Won't last long.
customer_reviews.text: I got these in 2015 for $23. Like all hard-wired headphones, the wires eventually fail and the only course of action is to buy a new set. I use headphones all day everyday, so these were toast after about 3 months. The only reason I'm even reviewing them now is because I was trying to figure out what headphones I've purchased in the past, and saw these in the order history. I used them for such a short period of time that I had forgotten they existed. Now I see that they're actually twice the price I paid, so I can't possibly recommend them to anyone for any reason.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J.

customer_reviews.title: headphones died after less than two years
customer_reviews.text: They lasted exactly one year and nine months (of daily careless use) before they went out in one ear. So why isn't it a negative review when they didn't even last two years? It's because they're so awesome while they do last. Everything sounds so clear and loud. I just bought a second pair, because I can't imagine going back to cheap headphones after having these. They get ridiculously loud with very little distortion. Be prepared to replace them, but hey, you have to replace your crackly cheap headphones, too, or else you wouldn't be reading this.
customer_reviews.author: dr. carpets

customer_reviews.title: What's with all the complaining? These are great.
customer_reviews.text: Weird. All the negatives that I read about these headphones simply isn't true, unless you're a maniacal audiophile. It can handle getting loud, the songs I've listened to are in perfect stereo. The bass is plentiful. The sharps are, well, sharp. Lightweight, over the ear, adjustable up & down with the earpieces. Cord is long enough to reach my bed, which is perfect because I listen to music everynight as I go to bed. The way I look at it? It's a lower end Mercedes in the Mercedes showroom. It's a low end Sennheiser, but it still beats the crap you can buy in most stores. Recommended? Absolutely a great, inexpensive pair for the average Joe's ears.
customer_reviews.author: Stomper

customer_reviews.title: One day.
customer_reviews.text: One day. That’s how long it took for the new sennheiser HD 202 headphones to fall apart. They have “bass boosted” audio which is garbage when working with film audio as it’s not equalized. Hurts my ears to listen to after about five minutes. Top head cushion fell off and the ear muffs are smaller than the previous ones. 8 years. That’s how long my old style sennheiser HD 202 headphones lasted before finally giving out. Quality products are dead.
customer_reviews.author: Blevin

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Sound Quality. Found it through Audiophile recommendations.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headphones for the price. I've been rocking them for about 9 months and hopefully haven't been to inaccessible at work. Helps me focus as long as I don't get too caught up in the music or podcasts! The ears do get hot, but many people recommend changing those out for other earpads. I'm just too lazy to do it. I have never owned a pair of over-ear headphones. Experiencing the full range of sounds from my music made me realize I didn't know what I had been missing for the last thirty years or so. Sennheiser beats Beats any day of the week, and twice on Sunday, btw. Check the message boards.
customer_reviews.author: GigaLuke

customer_reviews.title: I've converted to Sennheiser
customer_reviews.text: These headphones got me converted to Sennheiser. I was remarkably surprised with the sound quality, clarity and bass setup for this particular price point. They were thrown in my backpack all over Europe this spring and proved to be super durable. They are smaller over the ear headphones, which fit me just fine, but I could see how a larger eared person could not like them as much. I liked these so much I upgraded to a pair of Sennheiser Urbanite XLs for my office headphones and they blew my mind.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S.

customer_reviews.title: A few cons, but still really good!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, these headphones are really nice for $25. My only cons are that the cups are a little too small for my big ears, the fabric next to the speaker inside touches the outside of my ear, and the cups have a vinyl-like material that will probably have to be replaced in a year or so. However, they are probably the BEST sounding headphones I have ever purchased in this price range. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart B.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty freaking amazing.  Very good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: FOR THE PRICE I PAID these are pretty freaking amazing. The sound is great, a good amount of (as advertised) "powerful" bass and overall just good "clarity." I am by no means any expert on headphones and I wasn't even even familiar with this brand I just read good things about Sennheiser & bought these puppies at under $22. As I said pretty amazing. Mainly I'm listening to Radiohead's new album with these and so far they sound GREAT. & as far as Sennheiser goes I think these are one of their more inexpensive models but for inexpensive they're pretty awesome. To me they sound better than my $45 Panasonics. I recommend Sennheiser!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: My second pair
customer_reviews.text: Seven years ago I bought this exact pair headphones and I finally had to replace them. Good news: The high frequencies sound better but possibly just because my old ones were worn out. The cord is softer, I don't think it's going to get tangled and twisted as easily. Bad news: The head band cushion was coming off when I opened them but the adhesive seems to be holding now The cord clip/winder is unusable. Comparing it to my old one shows that the holes for holding cord in place are too small and sharp: forcing the cord in would have damaged the wire. The cutouts are too straight and too narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great phones for the price but they do have issues.
customer_reviews.text: These are great phones for the price, I use them in a small studio and I like them alot...BUT. Like so many others here this is my second set because the wires are so flimsy that they pull out of the speakers after even moderate use/abuse. I took apart my first set and soldered the wires back in place but they failed again, so after 5 years and one repair I bought a new set. Only the wires keep them from getting five stars, the fit/comfort is 9/10, noise cancellation is 7/10, performance is 8/10, and the price is 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: Frosty

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: This pair is no comparison to the old version of Sennheiser HD 202 that I got 10 years ago. I'm not sure if this is even the same model?? My old pair was broken and so looking for exact model to purchase. I needed them to use for practicing with my electronic drums. It was disappointing, the cable is really short (must be 1/5 the length of old pair!!), the bass sound is very low, over all sound quality is not the same as the old one. I would go for a different model!
customer_reviews.author: Dion

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great! Buy a few!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my music studio. Best sounding headphones for under 100 bucks (in my opinion). If you're going to provide headphones for multiple people, it's best if they are all the same brand and model. These are inexpensive enough that buying a few pair won't break the bank. Sound is great. Not flat, so don't use for mixing your next big hit, but great for monitoring in a studio. The wire is thin, which is good and bad. Good because it makes for a lighter and more comfortable wearing experience. Bad because I worry a less-smart musician might step on a wire or pull away too hard and damage the wire. Still great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Computer Nerd Musician Guy

customer_reviews.title: Broken wire on one ear in couple years Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Just like every other brand in every price range I buy, one ear goes out because the wire comes loose or breaks near the plug or at the phone. Going to buy vintage because they use heavy gauge wire. These have never left the side of my turn table and I use once a month and sure enough minor use the wire breaks. Garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Love Life

customer_reviews.title: Really Good Quality, Fantastic Price.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic noise cancelation and directional audio. In my opinion they are comfortable for 3 to 4 hours, then I have to take them off for at least a half hour so my ears can "breathe" a little. I also love the adjusting mechanism being built in on the back of the actual speaker holding compartment and not in the band. This makes them much more durable. Only reason I'm not rating it 5 stars is because of the ridiculously long cord which is tough to keep out of your way.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Rausch

customer_reviews.title: Bad fit for me...
customer_reviews.text: These do not fit well on my large (7 3/4" hat size) head and even with the resulting tight fit the ear pads feel like they're at a weird angle and about to slip off. They don't, but they feel like they will, which is a strange sensation. Nicely made headphones as you'd expect from Sennheiser and the sound is OK, but the fit really annoys me, possibly because every other headphone I own (ALL Sennheisers by the way) or have ever owned are or were MUCH more comfortable OVER-EAR headphones and not ON-EAR headphones like these. No more on-ear headphones of any kind for me.
customer_reviews.author: Scientia est Deus

customer_reviews.title: Super disappointed
customer_reviews.text: First, these are not over-the-ear headphones, unless you have tiny ears. Then, they started falling apart shortly after opening them. The foam around the ear pieces fell off. I had previously bought a low-end set of Sennheisers and they are still working great after 2 years. Unfortunately they don't make those anymore. I would absolutely not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bisson

customer_reviews.title: Would not hesitate to recommend especially at this price
customer_reviews.text: These are my main headphones for gaming. It doesn't have a mic, so not good for Multiplayer gamers, but I only play single-player games, so this wasn't a concern. The sound is good, not great, but good enough considering the low price. Remember, you are not paying $200 for these babys. The headphones have been remarkably durable...I tend to abuse most products, but the worst thing to happen is the earpad came off. I put it back on and kept going. The construction is basically all plastic, but it works well. The sound has always been solid. Good low and mid tones. I think for the price it is a product I wouldn't hesitate to recommend.
customer_reviews.author: P. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's maybe a bit better than what you can otherwise expect. I find them to be quite comfortable and stylish. (The cord is hilariously long and very cumbersome but that's not really something you can fault it for.) However, I'll admit that I'm not an audiophile with a discerning ear, but in my experience Apple earbuds have better sound quality than these phones, especially for bass. These do block out a bit more sound than earbuds do simply by virtue of being over-ear phones rather than in-ear. So not an amazing solution, but certainly better for certain settings that require a beefier product with heavier-duty cables.
customer_reviews.author: NickTop Contributor: Architecture

customer_reviews.title: Average everything, Not Comfortable to Wear
customer_reviews.text: If you really want a pair of headphones that are comfortable, this is definitely not for you. The sound quality is average. For the price, it is probably okay, but I would not recommend it to anyone though. These headphones' idea of noise canceling is just clamping on your ears tightly, which is okay for the price, but it gets uncomfortable pretty quickly. Don't think that is good for your ears. Save up to get a pair of headphones that are more expensive but actually have good sound quality and comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Awesome headphones!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best pairs of headphones I've ever bought, especially for the price. The cable is *really* long, which is great for where I use it most - my desk at work - since it lets me roll around to various places without having to worry about yanking the cable out of anywhere. But it also comes with a nice rolling clip thing to organize the excess wire in whatever way you want, or not at all. And I'm no audiophile, but I think the quality is fantastic, plus the headphones themselves are really great at sealing out ambient noise without active cancellation.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: i feel like these are actually worth a little more than MSRP
customer_reviews.text: i feel like these are actually worth a little more than MSRP..but in the world of audiophile headphones, that's still not saying much. comfy, adjustable headset and earmuffs. great sound quality for the price, until you get into the high ends; at max volumes, cymbals at the like sound atrocious through these. they do sound pretty good at lower volumes though. and while there must be someone out there that needs 15ft of headphone wire, i'm not them. it sounded like a lot before i ordered them, and it was even more than i had (incorrectly) envisioned.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: I Finally Found a Set I Can Live With
customer_reviews.text: My previous headphones gave out, and I was besieged by the long list of replacement options. This set had good reviews, and many of them. So I gave it a try. They are very substantial, noise canceling, and come with a neat plastic component that allows you to wrap and secure any extra cord so it doesn't flop around and get caught. The cord is long....good thing. So many headphone sets have very short cords, which requires that I go hunting in my electronics box for an extension. If these die down the road, I would purchase them again. The price is extremely reasonable for the high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Susana

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: While I didn't expect anything amazing at the price, I expected a lot more from Sennheiser. They actually sound pretty good, when you can get the sound to come through them. On about the fifth or sixth use, the jack started shorting out. Every time I use them, I have to make sure it's set "just right" or the sound doesn't come through. But when it does come, it's got a good balance with enough bass. The headphones are uncomfortable and have a very cheap feel. They squeeze on my head a lot, no matter how I adjust them. Maybe they'd "break in" and stretch a bit with use, but getting them to work is frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Mylo's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Gave them to my son
customer_reviews.text: Well I used them for 2 days. I am an average size male, 5'9" 195lb and these headphones hurt my ears. The headset isn't on right now and I still feel my earlobes throbbing.... Not cool. The sound was subpar too. I've owned Sennheiser headphones before and loved them... I'm searching for more expensive over the ear Sennheiser now. Not sure how these have such a good rating?!?!
customer_reviews.author: customgtp

customer_reviews.title: Have Been Very Durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in 2013, they still work flawlessly. No problem with the long cord as it has that cord spool I like that they fit snug. Sound great, look great with a minimalist non-bulky design, and have been very durable. Mids/highs/bass are perfectly great at this price point. I'm not going to be Dr. Audiophile reviewing these. Quite a price increase recently. I am reviewing them in light of the $28 I spent on them.
customer_reviews.author: trombone

customer_reviews.title: Better than Bose?
customer_reviews.text: Update after using for a couple years: These fit nicely (though a little tight for my giant head) and are light-weight. My boyfriend says they have better sound quality than his Bose earphones of a similar style, for a fraction of the price. While I never tried his Bose, these have excellent sound quality, decent at cancelling outside noise even at low volumes, and the bass notes are very rich. My only problem is that the cord is INSANELY long-- longer than what the average person would need in a pair of headphones--I was told they are for studio use. My music/headphones-snob friend was even impressed by them, which is saying a lot! Overall, great headphones, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Liz S

customer_reviews.title: 4 Years !!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow ..Sounds great with a alright bass not the best and had it for 4 years and still working ..it never had no issues, fell a couple at times as well ..Just look at that price now $49.99 ..i paid $19.99 hahaha ...hmmm will i buy it again at this price ..according to the now recent competitors **** I BOUGHT THE Sennheiser HD 202 , THIS IS Sennheiser HD 202 ii ...Thats why price is higher *****
customer_reviews.author: Terry Singh

customer_reviews.title: Only good for a Year
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 1st headset on 4-22-15 Worked great up to until 6-9-16. Purchased another headset on this date. May 2018 unit broke. Same problem as the first time. Right earphone wire broke inside the headset and the sound would go in and out. I use it for my computer only. It seems Sennheiser quality is going away. So much for German Engineering. I paid $24. for the last unit and it is now $64. for the same unit.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: ) These headphones have great quality sound IMO
customer_reviews.text: I can't use any other headphones than these, so I buy about 4 or 5 at a time. I'm 80% hearing impaired and can only watch TV with headphones and closed captions ... without getting evicted! :) These headphones have great quality sound IMO. Please note that I am hearing impaired as stated above, so I don't know how other people hear. I tried wireless ones so many times and none of them are strong enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kudos2Writers

customer_reviews.title: The cord is extra super long, which I didn't notice when ordering
customer_reviews.text: Overall they're just ok. I use these primarily with an electric piano. The cord is extra super long, which I didn't notice when ordering, but it comes with a clip to keep the excess cord bundled and the extra length is sometimes a good thing. The ears are thickly padded and comfortable. The depth is easy to adjust and hold their position, unlike other cheap headphones. I'm not a sound person so I don't know if I'm describing this right, but while the midrange sound is ok, high notes make me cringe. It's almost a little bit painful.
customer_reviews.author: AC75

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser continues to amaze.
customer_reviews.text: A tremendous hit from one of the most iconic names in professional audio. 1. These are incredibly light weight 2. The acoustic response is very balanced with punchy bass that does not over power the other ranges 3. Despite being over ear headsets, they allow you to hear conversations if they are close enough, great design feature. 4. Ultra comfortable and ergonomically fit with great padding, you can wear these for hours without fatigue. 5. THE PRICE is SPECTACULAR! Normally you get throw-away no name headsets for this price, these Sennheisers are impressive and at this price, see if you can get a better headset, I'd be shocked if you can.
customer_reviews.author: ChronosInfinitum

customer_reviews.title: Drownd out the annoying co-workers with ease
customer_reviews.text: For $20 these things rock. Although there is a supper long cord that is annoying. However it might come in handy if I ever need a way to escape the 8th floor of my building through the window. Once I put these on and am pumping in the EDM, all my annoying coworkers who talk insistently about their cats and weird body functions, fade into the background. I can wear them all day or just hang them high for everyone to see the large Sennheiser logo on the side, to advertise I have good taste in headphones.
customer_reviews.author: The Corey

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and great sound!
customer_reviews.text: Had another pair of these for about 4 years when the sound in the left ear suddenly went out. But the sound quality during the time they worked was so good, that I insisted on replacing them with the exact same model. I have some slight hearing difficulties, and these allow me to enjoy the full range of whatever sound I'm listening to. The bass is solid but not overwhelming, and there's no "tin can" effect like some cheaper-quality headphones or speakers. Not only that, but they are comfortable! So even if these new ones only last a couple of years, I will almost certainly replace them with the same ones again!
customer_reviews.author: Kerriann

customer_reviews.title: The headphones have good music quality
customer_reviews.text: The headphones have good music quality, and will block the outside noises away. The only thing I don't like is the cable is very long, and I don't need the length 95% of the time (mainly use it at work desk). When I wrap the cable around the plastic round belt clip it can be heavy. I often find myself sort of dragging the cables knot around. The cable also can get loose and fall of the clip easily.
customer_reviews.author: amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Love the sound but the wires came loose on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the sound but the wires came loose on the inside somehow and stored working. I'm lucky enough to be handy to where I open them up and resolder the wire but for most people this wouldn't be ideal. It could have been just my pair but I would second-guess getting these.
customer_reviews.author: Jack D.

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones for my piano because the reviews said the cable was quite long. I'm glad I did, these are excellent headphones. The sound quality is crisp and sharp with good bass as well. I now use them as my main headphones for everything at home including piano playing. The cable is very long, which might be an issue for some but it does come with a good solid cable spool so that you can stash the excess and the length is great for getting behind the piano without pulling or getting in the way.
customer_reviews.author: beecee

customer_reviews.title: Failed after one year. Poor quality for price.
customer_reviews.text: These HD 202 Sennheisers sold for $24 in 2017. Now they're double that. They're not worth the price, as they typically don't last much more than a year before you have to replace them. It's hard to understand the justification for the doubling in the price, for the exact same build quality. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Dollar for dollar, easily the best wired headphones on the market.
customer_reviews.text: Comfort is good for long sessions. Build quality is as good as you can expect from plastic cans. Ear cups adjust well enough, and the headband fits decently if not perfectly. But at the end of the day, this is about sound quality, and these are as close as you'll get to true studio monitors for less than a Benjamin. Note: The cable on these headphones is LONG. Long enough that you'll need to use the included cord-winder if you want to listen to them on your commute. That makes them ideal for studio use (we've got 3 for our podcast), but if you're looking for something portable, these are probably not your best bet.
customer_reviews.author: A. Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Possibly defective unit - less bassy than Sennheiser 203s, yet marketed as having powerful bass.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a replacement for my Sennheiser HD 203s that finally broke after nearly a decade. Opened these up and tried some music and I can tell they're defective within the first second. There is little bass in the left ear and a rattling at moderate to high volumes. I expected better from Sennheiser as the 203s were my first and only experience with them and those headphones lasted through highschool, college, and after with no complaints. If this is how the bass is supposed to be with these headphones, then I'm seriously disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: These are great headphones. I needed a pair that would go ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great headphones. I needed a pair that would go AROUND my ears, though these are not listed as 'around the ear' phones, my smallish ears fit inside just fine. I did not realize they came with a 'stereo cord' which is super duper long and has a bulky device which allows you to wrap them up to make the cord shorter, but it's always falling off the desk or swinging around as I walk. Otherwise, they are comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Decent headphones at more than reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't call these professional headphones. They are a little better than good headphones. I would give them 3 stars for quality and the forth for price. For $20, these are definitely worth it so far. I've only had them a couple months and they are working out great. I mostly just use them each night to listen to some music. I've seen some of the reviews and I concur there is a bit too much bass but overall they sound pretty good to me.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L WeschTop Contributor: Fashion Design

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Love these, there loud and clear, but not overbearing load at high volumes. The sound is balanced at all volume levels and does not sound to overpowered in either of the three categories of highs, mids, or lows. Bass is decent, where it does not overshadow the other frequencies. I would recommend these for any beginner or casual listener, especially at the price. best wired nonbiased headphones I have used. For the price give these as gifts or keep a few for your family because there great and cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, well-made, good audio quality and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I just wrote a review on the bluetooth headphones I bought to make the leap to bluetooth, and I found myself noting how this Sennheiser pair is pretty superior in audio consistency and comfort. It's just not wireless. I purchased these for around $22 to do caption and transcription work. The audio quality has met my needs and they are noticeably more comfortable than my bluetooth set. They were an affordable option, reliable and well-made.
customer_reviews.author: Liquid Sunshine ShopperTop Contributor: Nail Polish

customer_reviews.title: these are great headphones. They fit completely over my ears
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these are great headphones. They fit completely over my ears, but do interfere with large/dangle earrings. The sound quality is good. They don't have exceptional bass. Just standard sound output, but that's fine for my purposes. Noise cancellation is also average--muffles, but doesn't completely eliminate noise. The louder you turn the music, the less you hear! Overall I am very satisfied with these as just a set of headphones to use at work (earbuds usually hurt my ears, so I prefer over the ear headphones).
customer_reviews.author: Lola Lu

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones....with a bad 'wrap'.
customer_reviews.text: Well, the product itself is great. Lightweight, comfortable, great sounding headphones. I'm enjoying them as I write this review. The only problem I had was removing them from the stubborn welded plastic clam-shell packaging they came in. If mankind ever manages to destroy itself in a nuclear holocaust, at least we can all rest assured that any future race of beings that rediscovers this planet will find intact, in their indestructible bomb-proof plastic clam-shell cases, lots of unscathed headphones and other items. I just hope that, when they to try to open them, another wrap-rage fueled galactic holocaust is avoided.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: My husband had been wanting some headphones. Since he is an Audio specialist, I was concerned about quality. If anyone would notice subpar - he would. I asked the kiddo what to buy, and he said that Sennheiser is top quality - so I ordered these. This headset is really impressive. The ear portion is padded, and cups the ears comfortably. It's relatively light, and the sound is excellent. My husband is very happy with his gift! Definitely worth 5 stars! I'll add more specs later, when he can give me details but you can't go wrong with this set.
customer_reviews.author: Red McNamara

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: First thing to note, these are NOT sound suppressive, but they are cushioned enough they block a substantial amount of sound. There are no batteries or electronic components that block outside sound, they are just really well insulated. The long cord is a really nice feature in my opinion, and they give you are cord winder as well. They are really comfortable ON EAR, not over, headphones. Sound quality is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: John Hagge

customer_reviews.title: I really like these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I really like these headphones. Here's my assessment: -Super comfortable - the padding at the top and the well-shaped over-ear padding make them comfortable to keep on for long periods of time. Since I got these to use at work during some long days of data entry, this is a real plus for me. -Good audio quality - these are not top-of-the-line amazing, especially in the lower range, but the sound is clear, and that's really all I was looking for. For the price, these really can't be beat.

customer_reviews.title: Lacks comfort
customer_reviews.text: Great budget headphones. Comfort level is low since these headphones by design will sit on your ears. That's even more annoying if you wear glasses. The feel is normal for headphones in this category. Sound levels are good, I don't see a problem with volume. I'm no expert in audio so I can't say anything about accuracy of sound reproduction or if it has a good linear response. I would not pay more than $30, and would feel more comfortable paying under $20 for these. Cable length may be a bit long for some folks, it may be in the way for some also. Zip ties and Velcro is a life saver for any wire mess.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headphones for an amazing price. I am always looking for good studio headphones with little to no boost and keep coming back to these. They offer high quality sound, that doesn't clip or distort. The extra long cord is dourable, and is great for studio use. My only complaint is that they are a little bit too small to be completely 'around ear' phones for me and partially rest against my ears. Not a problem for short use of up to 3 hours, but prolonged use can result in ear aches. 100% would recommend, and plan on buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed very muddy sound
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in these headphones. I was really looking forward to getting a cool new set of headphones to replace my standard Apple in-ear pair. They still work fine but I wanted to be blown away by Sennheiser at a reasonable price! They sound worse than the Apple in-ear. I did a side by side test and it wasn't even close. The Senns were muddy, Apple is clear and sharp. I am no audiophile but I listen to headphones for hours every day on a train. Don't be cheap like I was and think you got a score.
customer_reviews.author: ButchCassidy

customer_reviews.title: Five Years Going Strong
customer_reviews.text: I've had these headphones for nearly five years now. They've held up perfectly. Sound quality is good enough and they are pretty comfortable. I purchased them for $22. For the current price of $36 you may be able to find other headphones that perform as well or better, but I have no issues with these.
customer_reviews.author: Copeland Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for everyone but me
customer_reviews.text: They seem well enough made, they work fine, and they're a bargain. I recommend them for almost anyone who isn't me. "Huh?", I hear you cry. I have an unusually large head -- buying hats is a challenge. These headphones were tight enough on me that they were painful after 10 seconds or so. It was weird -- I felt the pain in my jaw. I'm passing them on to my kid, and have ordered different headphones for myself. But, most people should have no issue.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Feist

customer_reviews.title: not bad,,, i'd buy them again
customer_reviews.text: a tad snug but not uncomfortable... there is a bit more bass than i expected but that also depends on the headphones you are used to... the cord is quite long but comes with a spool to wrap the excess as necessary... they are NOT noise cancelling but do block a large amount of ambient noise... my laptop only drives speakers to a moderate volume (loud but not ear-blasting) so i can not tell you how well they sound if you use an in-line amplifier
customer_reviews.author: 13kenzie

customer_reviews.title: I was VERY disappointed as I didnt think i would still be able ...
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of these headphones were purchased in 2005 and they lasted until this year when they finally died due to the cable in one of the headphones braking. That's 11 years of professional music and video editing use! I was VERY disappointed as I didnt think i would still be able to find a replacement. I was astounded that not only did I find the identical headphones, but they were so cheap, and actually turned up 3 days earlier than expected. I'm thrilled to say they are as good as the first set. and I have no doubt they will last as long :0)
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: but served its purpose in that the sound was really great and it was a good price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I wasn't sure if I wanted to invest in a more expensive model and wanted something that could block out noise in the office. This pair only muffled external noises (didn't completely block it), but served its purpose in that the sound was really great and it was a good price. My main complaint is that the sound went out in one ear after only 6 months of periodic use (which seems to be a common problem based on other reviews). Next time I'll buy something that's a bit more expensive but will last longer. However, if you're just looking for a cheap pair of headphones for short term use, this is a good option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and the sound isn't terrible. They are not super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Three stars because they do produce sound, and the sound isn't terrible. They are not super comfortable, but mostly they just feel cheap. I was very surprised how cheap they felt. I have heard nothing but good about the Sennheiser brand, but these seem no better than any other cheap knock-off headphones, albeit with larger ear cups. I think I'll keep trying.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for anyone who has hearing problems
customer_reviews.text: I have a hearing problem... (Thought I reviewed this item already) so these headphones work great with my TV's and computer. They have a long cord that has a wrapping oval to hold the cord to the length you need to unwind for use of these headphones. Very comfortable also on the ears... (unless you wear glasses.) Good price ... swift shipment... Will purchase second set so I don't have to carry them from room to room. Recommend these for those who have hearing problems and do not have hearing aids... or cannot afford hearing aids. Price... great... shipment... great. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Hamm

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap set of cans
customer_reviews.text: I'd say these are a little below the quality of comparably priced Sony MDX's. They are a bit tinny and lack low end response out of the box. Even though these are over the ear, there is barely any ambient noise reduction. The cord is 10 feet so there's a little loss of gain I'd imagine. But, I've had bad luck with wireless/bluetooth models and these will work for listening to the TV/watching movies when the house needs to stay quiet. The cord wrap is handy because with 10 feet of cord flopping around you'll want to use it when you've got slack.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Heem

customer_reviews.title: These headphones not only provide me with excellent sound and voice clarity (necessary for my job)
customer_reviews.text: I work at home and have 4 dogs (#80 each) that bark and howl whenever a leaf blows by. These headphones not only provide me with excellent sound and voice clarity (necessary for my job), but they provide a barrier so I hear less than half of the barking from the dogs. Amazing! I'm considering buying a spare so I'll never have to be without. I have two other headsets I've paid over $100 each for, and none comes close to the quality of these regarding sound clarity. Excellent product, Wonderful pricing!
customer_reviews.author: Albs

customer_reviews.title: Used By Radio Stations!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a part time DJ at local radio station WVUD 91.3 FM, these are the same headphones the station provides. I liked them enough to buy them for my own use. Excellent value for the money - noise cancelling, can really pump up the volume without distortion. I gave these 4 stars since they are tight on my head - they're new and will take a bit of breaking in - I do not want to risk breaking the headband so I am not going to bend it. The ones at the station are very comfortable since they are used all of the time.
customer_reviews.author: matt8386

customer_reviews.title: GREATNESS!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. These headphones are better than expected. These are my 10th time buying headphones because the last headphones I got were had either a weak sound, uncomfortable, only working on the left ear, breakable, or all of the above. But these.. These are great! They're comfortable and GREAT sound. Way better than Sony, Skull Candy, Panasonic, Dre's Beats, or Apple headphones. The volume is at full extent.. Which is a great advantage because lowering it down won't be a problem and shutting the world off and being in your own space with no noise overpowering your music will exist with these headphones !! Definitely a great purchase. And the bass is amazing !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla G.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money, Again.
customer_reviews.text: I actually like this brand of headphones, when I first bought it. I like the bass and everything. After 6 months of the ear cups stops working. So I bought another one but after 3 months the same problem occurred with one of the ear cups failing to work. Second time these headphones stop working. I wind up getting Sony MDR-ZX100. And sony headphones have lasted a year and show no signs of quitting. So I can't recommend anyone getting this.
customer_reviews.author: Alchemist

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and fit with reasonably good sound
customer_reviews.text: I wanted some no nonsense decent quality headphones at a good price to listen to music while I'm working at home. I did a considerable amount of research before settling on the HD 202s. I guess I new what to expect so I wasn't blown away with anything about these headphones. I am however satisfied and content with my purchase. No ear fatigue after two hours of listening and I got great performance no matter what I listened to. The cord is outrageously long. It has a goofy wind-up cord holder that I will likely never use. It also came with an adapter for plugging into professional equipment with a 1/4 plug.
customer_reviews.author: FatheringAutism

customer_reviews.title: FIVE stars for sound.....lost one for fit
customer_reviews.text: Five stars for sound, but fit could be a little more adjustable. I like to listen to music as I fall asleep. When my last headphones broke, I wanted something more sturdy (the headpiece snapped) and saw these. Sound...great...no complaints. But as a woman with certainly no bigger than a medium size head and not "big" hair, this really clamped down. Comfy as far as the earpieces on my ears, but wow, tight. I only took off one star for fit as fit is very individual. Some people might be able to wear these for hours and hours and have it be totally comfy. After an hour or two....I found it not so comfy.
customer_reviews.author: pleineluneTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I was about to get disappointed at how LIGHT it felt (I'm used to heavier ...
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by the quality of the sound. Before I put it on to test it out (was a gift to my mom), I was about to get disappointed at how LIGHT it felt (I'm used to heavier headphones) because I thought it wouldn't be able to block out ambient noise as well, but once it's on and you're listening to something, it exceeded all expectations! I'm really glad I got this and my mom was very happy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Y. K.

customer_reviews.title: They do the job.
customer_reviews.text: If you're an adult, unless you have small ears, these aren't going to cover or go over them. For kids, yes. For adults, no. With that being said, these still are pretty decent headphones. Even though they won't cover the entire ear, they sit comfortably on top of it. So I guess I'll be using these until I find a pair that cover my ears like my previous headphones for studio use and when that happens, these will be my backups.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C.

customer_reviews.title: Best cheap studio style headphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought four of these for my podcast guests. They work great - except after a year or two the ear cups start to deteriorate and need replacement. If you don't mind this then these are the best value for the money. They're Sennheiser, after all.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Neuman

customer_reviews.title: 24 dollars
customer_reviews.text: My son has always preferred his Audio technica head phones but he constantly breaks them. I was looking for some that were lower priced. He liked these, I was shocked. I paid 24 dollars for them, and i could not be more pleased. They have an extra long cord, so it is perfect for him. The down sides were that they are rigid and very tight. Those are the reasons they wont last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Momo

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, bad cord
customer_reviews.text: Sound was great for the price, but the cord failed in less than 2 years. I am careful and do not tug or twist the cord, but the left channel is now intermittent. Not quite a long enough life....even at this price. Well...I just noticed the price is not what I paid. 2 years ago these were 23 bucks.....not getting these gain!
customer_reviews.author: J. C Clark

customer_reviews.title: studio quality...dollar store price...!!!
customer_reviews.text: these are a super value...amazing clarity....amazing loud full clear bass response.....these make listening to songs on your laptop in youtube actually enjoyable,,!!.,,,forget speakers,,,,,put these on, ignore your wife and sit back and groove in peace..there is no outside sound leakage for others to hear,,,, I also use them plugged in to my Orange micro terror amp.....really great sound for playing guitar,!!....careful though,,,if you get to ripping and jamming hard, they will get extremely LOUD......do not blow your ears out..! these are priced cheaper than the crap they sell at Walgreens and 20 times the quality,,,and it comes with a free 1/4" plug adaptor,, quality stuff...
customer_reviews.author: jimmy three

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones ever
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones ever. I feel like I'll be stuck in the 90's forever bc I hate the tiny ear buds that everyone wears. If you have the same problem I do, where ear buds are painful or just don't stay in your ear, then these are the solution. I use them for noise cancelling while sleeping during the day (night shifter here) and also when I travel. They are light weight, high quality materials and the sound is great. I have two pair and hope they never discontinue. Very comfortable and a great deal on amazon. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Craig

customer_reviews.title: Usable and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Keeping in mind the price point, these headphones work perfectly. The highest and lowest frequencies are undoubtedly weak. However, I don't hear any irritating attempt to compensate by boosting some intermediate frequencies. The result is a very usable pair of back-up headphones. They are comfortable to wear and not tiring. I've used them off and on (not as my main pair) for many months and have little to complain about.
customer_reviews.author: Half

customer_reviews.title: Ok sound
customer_reviews.text: I am comparing these to the VM audio elux which recently broke on me. Sound: sound is more bassy then normal headphones but still is missing some in comparison to the elux. Highs and mids are fairly good-not the clearest but passable. These headphones are not for bassheads. comfort: these are comfortable and flexible. The pad's coverings feel cheap, but the foam underneath is comfortable. I do not know about the durability Looks and profile: look good and has a low profile on your head which is nice. These headphones do not fold so travel with them might be a problem. overall good sound, but not too much bass.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product - just fix the hard plastic packaging to be better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product as I was searching for a reasonably priced decent headphone. It works amazingly well and the sound clarity you get is too good. Really sleek design and amazing through put. The only thing I am concerned about is the way it comes in the manufacturer packaging. The hard plastic is something that cut my fingers and I bled getting the head phone out. If you care about environment, please fix the packaging to be more human friendly that can be opened without using scissors or cutters. I tried opening with my hands though. Otherwise the product is great.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonRocks

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones for the price. The sound is every bit as good as my old Sony's that were twice the price. The one slight downside for me was that the ear-cups are quite small and don't fit all the way over my ears (my ears are on the large size). Even so, the ambient noise attenuation is very good, but they can get uncomfortable after extended use. I do like the cord take-up for use at my computer. It keeps the cord for getting tangled up (like in the wheels of my chair) which proved to be the demise of my Sony headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Human Bean

customer_reviews.title: Painful experience
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't fit well, in fact it squeezes my head until it hurts. Besides that it's ugly and doesn't have particularly good sound. I bought it to use it with a PC. The best I can say is that it seems durable and has a long cable but that's not good enough to make it worth it buying.
customer_reviews.author: swmagicien

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with these as I had never heard of them or heard out of them. I will say they are not my "beats" but they have a great sound quality to them. I don't know what they want me to do with that cord wrapper piece they came with but I use these in the gym as opposed to taking my beats and tearing them up. I would recommend these if your looking for a good quality sounding headphone. The price is good and I hear they back their products. Hopefully I will never have to find out.
customer_reviews.author: S. Runyon

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE!! I BOUGHT THESE HEADPHONES MARCH 14TH 2012. Yes 2012. And still working perfectly. Great sound. Descent bass. And the price, you just cant beat it. Sennheiser has a great product here. The ear pad just came off due to my kiddo biting it off like a pirahna. Nothing super glue cant fix. Again great product. Ohh the only con. Is the cord length, its really long. Just buy it you'll love it. Thanks amazon and sennheiser.
customer_reviews.author: zachary

customer_reviews.title: good headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable to wear for long periods. I've tested then for 2-3 hours at a time. They project good volume. I can keep my computer volume low and can still hear my music well. I purchased these thinking that I could block some of the noise at my office while I work. They only do a so-so job at noise canceling, so I have to play my music a little louder than I would wan to. Bonus: Very long cord. Also comes with a holder to wrap the cord around so it doesn't get in the way when you don't need it.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband about 6 months ago. He is disabled and home a lot. So he's pretty much glued to his computer. He used these to listen to music for hours and hours every day. The sound quality was excellent in his ears without disturbing me. (I work from home.) I'm using the past tense because the headband part broke. I still give this product four stars because he would fall asleep with them on and toss and turn. I really doubt they were meant to withstand that kind of usage. We'll be purchasing another set soon to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok headphone.  Not as comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The ear-cup design is too snug for me. The 2 dangling wires are annoying (better designs have just 1 wire on 1 side). The bass sounds a little muffed (not clear at all). And my ears got hot after about 30 minutes. I had issue with sound on the right ear occasionally dropped off. I decided to spend more on a better headphone. Bought the Philips SHP9500 on a promotional deal for a little bit more than twice the price of this, and I have been happy with it, as it's much more comfortable, only has 1 wire on the left ear, and the sound is much more pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffd

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected....
customer_reviews.text: They are Sennheisers, but these are the most uncomfortable headphones I have ever worn. As with most headphones, you would expect them to kind of "settle in" and get more comfortable during use, even right at the beginning. Not so with these -- they actually got worse the longer I wore them, until I finally couldn't take it any more. I felt like Curly in that head vise, with Moe crankin' it down -- that's what these headphones felt like. I've had el cheapo headphones that were a LOT more comfortable than these.
customer_reviews.author: RadMan

customer_reviews.title: I like these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I am not in to music and use these headphones for listening to movies and computer games. They work well and sound is good for the price. For me they are comfortable to wear for a long periods of time. This is my third pair of these headphones. On the first one pads surface came off, the second I still use at work and this one I keep using daily and they are still good. I think version II has improved pads and leather material so it lasts much longer. The cord is long and durable and over all I think they sound very well for the price and reasonably durable.
customer_reviews.author: Xwin

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Sound is Worth Twice the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Sennheiser has always been a good brand. When I saw the price of these I was amazed. I bought them to use with my Mackie sound mixer and I was not disappointed. They are noise canceling, if you don't like that then you won't want these. They fit nicely, the ear cups are big. What is great is that these are incredibly light. They are the lightest headphones I've ever tried on my mixer. The sound is crystal clear and it is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Good Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: This headphone comes with a mini-plug (3.5mm) at the end of the cable and a mini-jack to 1/4" plug adapter for use with full sized phone jacks. Fidelity is pretty good, although not excellent, but then you're not spending $100+ for these. Comfort is reasonable with the cups fitting around my ears and being adjustable enough to fit my off-center ears. We primarily use these for our digital pianos for silent practice at night.
customer_reviews.author: Dee NTop Contributor: Amazon Echo

customer_reviews.title: These were 18$ in 2011, 25$ in 2016 and now 50 dollars in 2018...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these headphones in 2012 for 18 dollars... Had to replace them in 2016 for 25 dollars... And now my pair finally broke again and they want 50 dollars the same pair of headphones. Inflation is one thing, but the increase is just ridiculous. I refuse to pay for their uncalled for price inflation on the same technology and design its been for 6+ years...

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality sound but uncomfortable to wear and they fall apart easily
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality sound but uncomfortable to wear and they fall apart easily. The cups fall off the headband. The cord is way too long and even though it comes with a cord wrap its still too long for personal use. The headband itself is tight and the cups have too little padding for any kind of extended wear. They are also bulky and difficult to travel with.
customer_reviews.author: Aeolisio

customer_reviews.title: Good Headphones for Podcasting/Editing
customer_reviews.text: Works very well for podcasting. While it doesn't have the best overall sound that headphones could have, it had clear sound for hearing all the podcast issues as well as the hard back to block out ambient noise. It also has a very long cord, which is convenient if you need it, but for me would get under the wheel of my computer chair...yes, it's that long. I ended up tieing up the cord to keep it restricted, but it is something to take note of. Once again, I did a lot of research and was not disappointed by the value for money I got for this.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Solid for the price, nothing exceptional
customer_reviews.text: Paid about $20 for these and they met expectations of a cheap pair of headphones. -They fit comfortably for about an hour or two before the cheap foam earpieces start to irritate your ears. -The backbone is very rigid plastic that probably won't last past a year of consistent use. -The cord seems like it is about 15 feet long, and can't be interchanged. -The music quality is nothing compared to high end headphones, but is serviceable for the average music listener. No real bass. Not super crisp. But again, they're hovering around $20, so you're getting what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: An excellent buy. I needed to listen to TV
customer_reviews.text: An excellent buy. I needed to listen to TV, radio, etc. but did not need the wireless capability or the perfectionist quality of the top rated (and expensive) headphones on the market. This model brings in nice clear sounds and the ear cups block out enough surrounding noise to make listening enjoyable. Dialogue is clearer than with quality speakers. Since it takes standard connections, a wire extension is cheap and easy to hide. One slight drawback: ears will get hot over time.... just remove them during a commercial break. Shipping and packaging were great, and the unit came without a scratch.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are some great headphones. The sound quality is nice, great separation with some decent bass. The long cable is great for working, as I can move around my work space without being pulled back by a short cable. They are extremely comfortable, even the headband. After years of use they still hold up amazing. They sound like new...and I use them almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: Erik G.

customer_reviews.title: They're a little loose and flimsy and seem like they will break, but work just fine for me!
customer_reviews.text: They're a little loose and flimsy and seem like they will break, but the sound quality is OK. I take extra good care of mine and store it in a place where it won't get crushed, and am very careful when I stretch them over my head as to not snap them in half. I use them for voice acting, and mostly keep them attached to my Blue Yeti mic and sitting on my chair, so they do not get too much use except when I am in the booth, and they are holding up so far. Comfort levels are OK- the pads are very soft and the top portion is also padded.
customer_reviews.author: Yinan

customer_reviews.title: I've bought 3 sets
customer_reviews.text: I've actually bought 3 sets of these. One for myself and 2 as Christmas gifts.They do a really nice job of knocking out background noise with being a passive set. To me anyway they are very comfortable, I can play drums for hours and have no pain on my ears or on the top of my head; I like that they have a long cord as well, I can run the wire down my back and not get tied up in it while playing.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K

customer_reviews.title: I really liked the last pair of Sennheisers I bought
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the last pair of Sennheisers I bought, and by all accounts these were supposed to be one step up, but the sound is a bit thinner, less bassy. And the ear cups are so enlongated that they can only be used in one position instead of many; haven't they noticed that not everyone puts their headphones on the same way? If you wanted to, say, put these on and rest your head, it's likely to push one cup partially off your head which wouldn't happen if you could put the arm under your chin. Some people have always worn over-the-ear phones with bar in the back, and if you do that with these, the sound leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Stepan Spoonwalla

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: If for some asinine reason all you've ever used is ear buds for music, you should give these a shot. Best bang for your buck that I've found. These headphones rock and they are only $24-30 online. This is my 3rd set in 9 years. I fall asleep with them on 3-5 nights a week. (In case you wondered why I've gone through so many) Excellent base response and all around amazing sound. In a blind test I would put them up against a $150 set of headphones and I'm willing to bet few could tell the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Ross

customer_reviews.title: junk wires!!!
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to be "that reviewer" but.. these were great for the money, until they weren't... After more than a decade of staying true to wired peripherals, I'm going wireless.. I've had countless dollars sunk into mice, keyboards and headsets that function perfectly, but suffer from a busted wire somewhere. I use my headset very carefully, in my office and yet I lost the right speaker to a obviously faulty wire.. The sound cuts in and out when I wiggle the wire where it goes into the can.. Sad because for the money these headphones were hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall quite nice
customer_reviews.text: They transfer a good sound when I have a low volume set. They are good to block out other noises when I need to be able to hear a movie or whatever (noisy neighbor or family). The cord is super long, and I don't ever need it that long, but there is a cord winder/holder that works very nicely to keep the extra cord out of the way. Any longer than a couple hours causes a little pain around the ears (I do wear glasses, so am not sure if that is a factor or not). Overall, they are just what I needed for good sturdy headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Clutter

customer_reviews.title: 1 year in use review. Best bang for the buck literally.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely high quality headphones that truly has the most bang for the buck.. literally. I've had these guys for nearly a year now, and that in itself is amazing because I go through headphones about every 3 months as I tend to step on them or accidentally sit on them, which is why I never buy them for more than $20 a pop. These guys when stepped on simply pop out of the headband, and then you just simply pop them back in. It's as if they never were stepped on in the first place. Lookwise they are very sleek and pro like, and are comfy to wear for extended hours. Can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: V. Jamali

product_meta.title: Sennheiser HD 202 II Professional Headphones (Black)
product_meta.description:
The Sennheiser HD202II are closed, dynamic hi-fi stereo headphones. Good insulation against ambient noise and a deep bass response make them the ideal companion for DJs - or anyone who likes to listen to modern, powerful music without disturbing others. High efficiency drivers for maximum performance. Sennheiser HD202II Closed Back Headphones Features include Closed,dynamic, semi-circumaural stereo headphones .Earcups can be removed from the headband ,Specially designed damping material ensures powerful bass response ,Lightweight turbine diaphragms for low bass .

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
General Description 

The HD 202 MK II closed, dynamic hi-fi stereo headphones are the ideal partner for DJs and powerful modern music, providing great insulation against ambient noise and a vivid, crisp bass response. The rugged lightweight headphones have a secure fit and can be used for both mobile sources and home (mini) hi-fi systems. When out and about, a convenient cord take-up lets you adjust the headphone cable to the required length.


Please note that models HD202 and HD202 MK11 are the same headphones and only the packaging differs.

FEATURES
 * Closed, supra-aural, dynamic hi-fi stereo headphones
 * Frequency Response 18Hz-18KHz
   
 * For DJs, ideal for both mobile sources and home mini hi-fi systems
 * Good attenuation of ambient noise
   
 * Earcups can be removed from the headband
   
 * Specially designed damping perforation ensures powerful bass response
   
 * Lightweight diaphragm material with “turbine” embossing for
   extremely low bass
   
 * Powerful neodymium magnets and lightweight diaphragms for high
   sound levels
   
 * Powerful bass and increased signal levels for modern
   rhythm-driven music
 * Clips to the belt: cord take-up for adjusting the cable length when listening on the move
   
 * Rugged outdoor design with durable and flexible headband
   
 * 3 m highly conductive OFC copper cable
   
 * Extremely comfortable to wear due to ultra-lightweight design, even for
   extended listening
   
 * Replaceable leatherette ear pads 
   
 * 2-year warranty





IE6 Dynamic In-Ear Headphones MX580 In-Ear Stereo Headphones with Integrated Vol Control
HD 218 Closed Back Headphones iPhone/iPod/mP3 Compatible


HD 201
